entry.content:
It is now possible to browse through my comics directly on my website. This feature will make my comics more accessible to people who aren't on social media.

I also made an image license applicable to all comics that are published on this part of my site. This license is designed to cater for online and educational usecases while being quite strict about printing my comics. For all details please read the full license and if you have any questions please do get in touch.

For those who want to use my comics according to the license, there is a handy package available for download at my Kofi-page, with both the english and the german version of all the comics in it. If you can afford it, you can support me by paying a small amount on the download page, but the package can also be downloaded for free.

entry.content:
The Exhibition took place at the Von Roll Campus in Bern and was coorganised with Susanne Enggist from the Institut für Heilpedagogik. It started with a Vernissage and was a great success. The Exhibition could be visited freely in the hallway of the main building during 20 days following the Venissage.

I also took a group of young students from the divergenta private school to a guided tour through the exhibition.

I also gave an interview which you can find on the PH Bern Website.

entry.content: From March 28, 2023 until April 10, 2023 the very first exhibition of my work took place at the KULeuven. Many of my drawings on being autistic were shown, some in Dutch, some in English. The opening event on March 28 also featured the showing of the documentary Seeing the unseen, about autistic women.

entry.title: Autistic Identity sketchnotes series
entry.content: Sometimes people discuss whether we should say autistic or with autism, or they don't want me to mention being autistic at all because I would be labeling myself. Well guess what, autistic is not a bad word, and it is absolutely part of who I am.
